background.text: ORDER BELOW EXH.1 1] Perused application and say. Heard Advocate for applicant and APP for the State. 2] This is first bail application filed under section 439 of Cr.P.C. by applicant in respect of his arrest in C.R. no. 34/19 registered at Dighi Police Station for the offence punishable under section 354 of the Indian Penal Code and under section 7,8 of the Protection of Children from Sexual Offences Act, 2012.

legalActFound.stringMatched: under section 439 of cr.p.c. by applicant in respect of his arrest in c.r. no. 34/19 registered at dighi police station for the offence punishable under section 354 of the indian penal code

arguments.text: It is alleged that mother of victim aged about 11 years lodged report stating that on 10.01.2019 at 11.30 a.m. she sent victim at Raziya Chicken Center for bringing Chicken. She came and was crying. Upon asking victim narrated that chicken center owner called her near counter, hold her hand and pressed her chest. He did same act prior to two months. Husband of first informant asked him reason of act, he apologized.

argumentSentences.text: It is alleged that mother of victim aged about 11 years lodged report stating that on 10.01.2019 at 11.30 a.m. she sent victim at Raziya Chicken Center for bringing Chicken.
She came and was crying.
Upon asking victim narrated that chicken center owner called her near counter, hold her hand and pressed her chest.
He did same act prior to two months.
Husband of first informant asked him reason of act, he apologized.

arguments.text: 3] According to applicant he is falsely implicated in this matter. Investigation is practically over. He is respectable person and doing business. He is resident of Dighi, Pune and ready to abide the conditions. He has no criminal antecedents. Hence, he prayed to release him on bail.

argumentSentences.text: 3] According to applicant he is falsely implicated in this matter.
Investigation is practically over.
He is respectable person and doing business.
He is resident of Dighi, Pune and ready to abide the conditions.
He has no criminal antecedents.
Hence, he prayed to release him on bail.

arguments.text: 4] APP and I.O. objected this application on the ground that investigation is in progress. Statement of victim under section 164 of Cr.P.C. yet not recorded. Applicant and victim are residing near each other. So, applicant will pressurize victim and witnesses. There is possibility of tampering prosecution evidence. Hence, they prayed to reject the application.

argumentSentences.text: 4] APP and I.O. objected this application on the ground that investigation is in progress.
Statement of victim under section 164 of Cr.P.C.
yet not recorded.
Applicant and victim are residing near each other.
So, applicant will pressurize victim and witnesses.
There is possibility of tampering prosecution evidence.
Hence, they prayed to reject the application.

arguments.text: 5] Allegations against the applicant are serious. Applicant is interrogated. Considering allegations and nature of offence investigation is practically over. Personal custody of applicant is not required. Applicant is doing business and his family members are depending on him . Applicant is resident of Dighi, Pune. Applicant has no criminal antecedents. No purpose would serve by keeping the applicant behind bar for unknown period. Due to all above reasons application deserves to be allowed with following order ­

argumentSentences.text: 5] Allegations against the applicant are serious.
Applicant is interrogated.
Considering allegations and nature of offence investigation is practically over.
Personal custody of applicant is not required.
Applicant is doing business and his family members are depending on him .
Applicant is resident of Dighi, Pune.
Applicant has no criminal antecedents.
No purpose would serve by keeping the applicant behind bar for unknown period.
Due to all above reasons application deserves to be allowed with following order ­

order.text: ORDER 1] The application is allowed. 2] The applicant Rejaul Nazrul Hoque be released on executing P.R. bond of Rs.40,000/­ with one or two solvent sureties in the like amount. 3] The applicant shall not tamper the prosecution witnesses in any manner. 4] The applicant shall attend Dighi Police Station on every Monday between 11.00 a.m. to 2.00 p.m. till the charge­sheet is filed. 5] The applicant shall not harass, meet the victim and threat and pressurize the victim or first informant and witnesses. 6] The applicant shall not repeat the offence and shall not enter in the vicinity of residence of victim. 7] The applicant shall co­operate investigating machinery as and when required. 8] Prior to furnishing surety, the applicant shall submit his address proof, mobile number and inform about the change in address and mobile number.

processedText:
Cri.Bail Application no. 229-19 CNR-MHPU01-000841-2019 
---header-ends---
ORDER BELOW EXH.1 1] Perused application and say. Heard Advocate for applicant and APP for the State. 2] This is first bail application filed under section 439 of Cr.P.C. by applicant in respect of his arrest in C.R. no. 34/19 registered at Dighi Police Station for the offence punishable under section 354 of the Indian Penal Code and under section 7,8 of the Protection of Children from Sexual Offences Act, 2012. 
---background-ends---
It is alleged that mother of victim aged about 11 years lodged report stating that on 10.01.2019 at 11.30 a.m. she sent victim at Raziya Chicken Center for bringing Chicken. She came and was crying. Upon asking victim narrated that chicken center owner called her near counter, hold her hand and pressed her chest. He did same act prior to two months. Husband of first informant asked him reason of act, he apologized. 
---argument-ends---
3] According to applicant he is falsely implicated in this matter. Investigation is practically over. He is respectable person and doing business. He is resident of Dighi, Pune and ready to abide the conditions. He has no criminal antecedents. Hence, he prayed to release him on bail. 
---argument-ends---
4] APP and I.O. objected this application on the ground that investigation is in progress. Statement of victim under section 164 of Cr.P.C. yet not recorded. Applicant and victim are residing near each other. So, applicant will pressurize victim and witnesses. There is possibility of tampering prosecution evidence. Hence, they prayed to reject the application. 
---argument-ends---
5] Allegations against the applicant are serious. Applicant is interrogated. Considering allegations and nature of offence investigation is practically over. Personal custody of applicant is not required. Applicant is doing business and his family members are depending on him . Applicant is resident of Dighi, Pune. Applicant has no criminal antecedents. No purpose would serve by keeping the applicant behind bar for unknown period. Due to all above reasons application deserves to be allowed with following order ­ 
---argument-ends---
ORDER 1] The application is allowed. 2] The applicant Rejaul Nazrul Hoque be released on executing P.R. bond of Rs.40,000/­ with one or two solvent sureties in the like amount. 3] The applicant shall not tamper the prosecution witnesses in any manner. 4] The applicant shall attend Dighi Police Station on every Monday between 11.00 a.m. to 2.00 p.m. till the charge­sheet is filed. 5] The applicant shall not harass, meet the victim and threat and pressurize the victim or first informant and witnesses. 6] The applicant shall not repeat the offence and shall not enter in the vicinity of residence of victim. 7] The applicant shall co­operate investigating machinery as and when required. 8] Prior to furnishing surety, the applicant shall submit his address proof, mobile number and inform about the change in address and mobile number. 
---order-ends---
Pune. (R.V.Adone) Date –24.01.2019. Addl.Sessions Judge, Pune. 3 Cri.Bail Application no. “ I affirm that the contents of the P.D.F. File Judgment are same word for word as per original judgment. Name of Steno ­ Court Name ­ Smt. R.V.Adone, Addl.Sessions Judge,Pune. Date of Order ­ 24.01.2019 Order signed by P.O. ­ 28.01.2019 Order uploaded on ­ 28.01.2019
